data.title: Good but standard breakfast
data.text: We had breakfast here on a Sunday morning.  It is clearly a popular place as we waited about 30 minutes for a table.  That may have raised my expectations too much as when our breakfasts arrived, they were good but nothing special.  I got the "Desperado" which was supposed to have chorizo in some fried potatoes with cheese and eggs on top.  Not much chorizo and very little spice.  I might try somewhere else for breakfast although the staff here are very nice.

data.title: Brunch with a friend
data.text: Always enjoy brunch at LePeep.  Had the Lumberjack combo and it was great.  Don't remember what friend ordered, but she was a member of the clean-plate club.

data.title: Nice breakfast
data.text:
While staying in downtown South Bend, we took the opportunity to step outside the hotel and try the La Peep restaurant for breakfast.  The staff was very accommodating and helpful. We were seated promptly and had coffee right away. They leave a carafe at the table so we could refill at our convenience.

The menu had some nice twists on old favorites. For example, I had eggs Benedict served on crab cakes rather than an English muffin. It was very good and a pleasant change. My wife had Hen Pen and enjoyed it.  The only critique we have is that the Pleasant Potatoes were a bit too salty for out taste.

If you’re in South Bend and looking of a little different take on breakfast, give La Peep a try.

data.title: Brunch before a show
data.text:
Everyone raves on how great Le Peep is. The food is good but nothing spectacular. They have a huge menu. Just about anything you want they have. I ordered an omelet and There were plenty of veggies.

Be prepared if they are busy to wait and there aren't a lot of places to sit and wait or no call ahead when busy.

All the staff was nice and friendly.

data.title: Great Peep.
data.text: We love to breakfast dine, and Le peep is one of the best. Service is generally awesome, to match the food selection. The owner is "in house" and runs a tight ship!

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Always make it here at least once when we visit South Bend/Notre Dame. Great breakfast choices; omelettes, french toast, eggs benedict...many with Le Peep's own special tweeks. Servers are usually very good. Owner, Peg, is on site making sure all is operating smoothly and she's a treat!

data.title: Breakfast for two on two mornings
data.text: Nice service and the omelets were good and filling. The next morning I had a crepe which was awful! I should have sent it back, but the place was packed and I didn't have time to wait for another dish. In our travels I saw that there are other Le Peeps. I didn't know it was a chain.

data.title: After church
data.text: A good place to go for breakfast, brunch, or and early lunch.  They have wonderful selections.  The wait staff is most helpful and courteous.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: This is another regular stop we make when in South Bend.  We always go for Breakfast.  This is a special place.  Don't miss it..

data.title: Normal pricing , nice menu!
data.text: This place seems to be high on price but a look at the menu while you wait shows that there is no sticker shock here . We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table which is fine be me as this place has a tendency to draw in a regular crowd of followers and new newcomers alike. This place mostly caters to breakfast items as the lunch menu has a few decent choices but will satisfy the appreciative adults. They have omelettes, skillets, combos, pancakes, waffles, etc. I ordered the biscuits and gravy with two eggs and a side of bacon. The biscuits are the heavy kind. Totally different than what most places would serve and that goes along with the unique sauce and sausage . My lady ordered the eggs Benedict , you can have it done 4-5 different ways but she ordered the vegetarian and it had a bunch of great flavors going on with it. We had a side waffle which was great too. The basic coffee they serve was excellent !! Service was good too. I will post pics.

data.title: Omelette you read this
data.text:
I was in South Bend for a meeting and stumbled upon this little spot on the Main Street.  The atmosphere is so inviting, local memorabilia everywhere and obvious Cubbies fans.  Expect a wait, no matter the day or time (which says a lot!)

I had the fajita pita and was thrilled with what I got.  The salad was fine, but I should add stuck with the awesome looking fried.  If you're ever in the mood for a great, mama's breakfast kinda joint this is where you should stop.

data.title: Good value and delicious
data.text: My adult daughter and I went for breakfast.  This place did not disappoint.  Best blueberry pancakes I have ever had.  I also sampled the eggs benedict and it was equally decadent. We saw people of every age group here.

data.title: "Homey Touch" in Downtown South Bend
data.text: I enjoyed my time this afternoon for brunch with my mother, who is not from this area. She asked me to take her to a cafe that has home-cooked goodness and Le Peep was what I had in mind since I had only been once before. I enjoyed it then -- was even better the second time. Shauna was a very attentive waitress and catered to our every need. We also appreciated gentleman host up front for his gentleman-like gesture to pull the chair out for my mother. Very kind, sweet, and thoughtful. South Bend has a true gem in it's downtown area! I recommend anyone who wants a delicious breakfast, brunch, or lunch option. There is a wide variety of meals to choose from and the menu is humorous. It's a wonderful touch to our area and I can't wait to go back! Thank you to Shauna, the host, and the cooks for splendid food and atmosphere!

data.title: Breakfast with some variety
data.text: They serve all the basic breakfast fare but we enjoyed the different take on Eggs Benedict.  Rather than the traditional ham or Canadien Bacon we tried the crab cake as well as a vegetable version.  Both were very satisfying, and fun.

data.title: Good Breakfast Choice
data.text:
Le Peep is a franchise restaurant group – and they do tend to vary widely from location to location.    I’m not a huge fan of the so-called “pancake houses” which have flourished in the South Bend area, so I tend to enjoy this sort of breakfast restaurant slightly better.  What this location does best is the basics – eggs, omelets, etc.   I find the skillet choices to be a bit odd: some with chorizo sausage, tomato sauces, green peppers, sausage gravy.  I wish the restaurant would offer a couple of simpler skillet preparations – maybe just a sausage, cheese, egg, and potato combo, or ham, egg, cheese and potato combo?   I would also stay clear of their more “exotic” breakfast choices such as “Crabcake Benedict” which is undoubtedly a pre-prepared food service item.   Also steer away from the salmon Benedict.  The salmon steak tasted like it had been cooked the day before and reused for this dish.  It was completely dried out and extremely fishy tasting. 

On the latest visit, service was prompt and personable.  I tried the steak and eggs – and the server did ask about how I wished my steak.  I requested medium rare.  It came instead cooked to death.  If there is a temperature beyond well done, this piece of shoe leather had reached it.  Coffee is served in carafes and the coffee is very tasty and full bodied.   I always call ahead for a table on Sundays and avoid the lengthy waits for a table.   Overall, a good choice for breakfast or a light lunch and certainly reasonably priced.

data.title: Not equal to hype
data.text: I had lunch at Le Peep for the first time last week.  I was VERY disappointed.  The menu has VERY FEW lunch items, and none of them appealed to me.  Therefore, I had a breakfast burrito, and was almost disgusted with the item before I had finished.  The salsa was MUCH too spicy to even eat.  The portion was rather small (for which I was grateful).  And, the waitress informed us that all egg dishes were $.75 higher than listed on the menu due to bird flu - BOLOGNA!!!!!!!!  I shall never return on my own.  I was there with a group from work.

data.title: Sunny Sunday Brunch
data.text:
What a lovely place to have brunch on a late Sunday morning.  Wait staff was courteous and helpful - explaining menu choices - which were plentiful.

The pancakes were especially good - very light and not heavy.  Eggs were cooked to request.  

Will definitely visit again.

data.title: Good Breakfast eggs prepared as ordered
data.text: Nice area to walk around. We ordered the Corned Beef Benedict, Lumberjack Breakfast. The eggs were perfectly prepared as ordered. One medium and the other plate scrambled. The pouched eggs on the benedict was perfect as well. Pancakes were surprisingly good. Potatoes crispy but a little too salty. Corned beef could have been cooked a little longer. Hollandaise sauce lacked flavor. One of my english muffins was half burnt. Kitchen should pay more attention to detail. Our server was friendly.

data.title: Bland
data.text: I don't care for their sausage, it doesn't look quite done. I know, so many rave about this place. I have only eaten there 2x, in my 15 years of working downtown. Food is rather bland. But many like it, it's always packed. I like food with flavor!

data.title: sorry to say disappointed
data.text: Let me first say that we have been here many times.  Usually the service is decent but this time it wasn't.  Our waitress only stopped by once after taking our order, someone else brought our food, and we never saw her again.  We needed boxes but it was as if we were invisible.  So we left.  I had a Philly sandwich which was ok but the onions were raw, as were the peppers.  I can tolerate raw peppers but not onions.  We were disappointed with our experience.
